title: Design and implement GET /api/v2/transactions/history endpoint
summary: Develop the unified transactions history REST API endpoint for customers to access consolidated historical data from all integrated partner banks. The implementation should ensure a robust and scalable backbone for subsequent features like filtering, pagination, and compliance. It is foundational for user-facing data aggregation in the OpenBanking domain.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Develop a RESTful API endpoint (GET /api/v2/transactions/history) to provide customers unified access to their transaction history from all integrated partner banks.

title: Implement pagination and filtering (date range, type, institution)
summary: Integrate pagination and filtering capabilities into the transactions history endpoint to allow users efficient navigation and querying by date range, transaction type, and institution. This ensures scalable data delivery and usability for customers accessing large volumes of transactions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: The API must offer pagination, filters (date range, transaction type, partner institution)...

title: Ensure OpenAPI (Swagger) 3.x compliance for requests/responses
summary: Guarantee that all API requests and responses conform to the OpenAPI (Swagger) 3.x specification. This allows for standardized client integrations and enhances interoperability between systems and documentation tooling.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: The API must ... conform to latest OpenAPI specifications.

title: Deduplicate transactions and harmonize transaction schemas
summary: Ensure that transactions from all partner banks are deduplicated and that differing schemas are harmonized for uniformity. This improves data consistency and reliability for downstream consumers and reporting processes.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Ensure deduplication, consistent formatting ... and harmonization of transaction types/statuses.

title: Normalize transaction timestamps to UTC and add original timezone metadata
summary: Standardize all transaction timestamps to UTC while preserving and flagging the original timezone metadata. This ensures temporal consistency across data from multiple partners and enhances downstream processing reliability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Normalization of timestamps to UTC (with original timezone metadata)...

title: Authenticate API with OAuth 2.0 and enforce per-customer tokens
summary: Protect the API by implementing OAuth 2.0 authentication, ensuring that each customer holds and uses an individual token for secure access. This upholds best practices in fintech security and regulatory compliance.

title: Log access events and enable ISO 27001-compliant audit trails
summary: Implement detailed logging of access events, ensuring auditability and traceability in accordance with ISO 27001 standards. This supports regulatory requirements and internal security monitoring.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Log access events for audit trails per ISO 27001.

title: Gracefully handle bank API outages and provide partial results with error logging
summary: On detection of bank API outages, the system must still provide customers with any available transaction data while clearly logging outages and communicating partial result status. This maximizes resilience and user trust in case of partial downstream failures.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: On partner bank outage, deliver partial results and log the issue.

title: Meet API response performance target (≤1.5s for up to 24 months’ data)
summary: Ensure the transactions history API responds within 1.5 seconds for data volumes covering up to two years, addressing both scalability and user-experience goals. This is vital for performance consistency and compliance with fintech SLAs.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Meet performance targets (≤1.5s for up to 24 months’ history)...

title: Deliver documentation and support channels, and enforce compliance/caching/integration constraints
summary: Provide comprehensive developer/user documentation and establish support channels. Also, ensure all compliance, data caching (max 5 minutes), and integration requirements with at least five major banks are met prior to deployment.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Deliver comprehensive documentation and integration with at least five major banks. Mandatory compliance review required before deployment.
